column4: I was assuming that file was the upgrade that was selected. If it's installed or now, I'm not sure.
What exactly are you hoping that dselect-upgrade (the proper option) will accomplish?
He said he tried to do an upgrade first and it failed, so I wanted him to dselect them

dselect is short for debian-select, a utility often used when installing a new system. It has nothing to do with "deselecting" a package. Please don't give advice about commands / topics you don't fully understand.
